1375.79.text:
able to confirm with us until

the school board and the

and Janelle had some other ideas

1403.78.text:
from recognized groups but they

1414.08.text:
We decided what Saturday

we knew it was going to be a

and we knew it was going

So we sent the

that information, all we had to

Janelle came up with 12

1437.10.text:
that could be had by our
Y.S.A.N. members

1441.44.text: and we narrowed it down to four.

1446.86.text:
in the morning and participants
would be able to pick which one

1449.28.text:
they wanted to go to, then

1451.66.text:

and then there were another

they could pick from

1462.29.text:
and some of the

So fast forward

Janelle's last week at work
and we're finally getting

1476.31.text:
We got the location confirmed,

1480.15.text:
in the emails, and she set up

We had 70 people register

55 attended and we had

so that was a good learning
for us

The smaller sessions just

1512.47.text:
and engaging newcomer youth, how

1520.94.text:
and how to work with

I guess our major learnings
we got from

1530.65.text:
got from this whole event were

IT Department to figure

The Y said,

so that fit in kind of with

We learned really to help

1557.77.text:

which one we were going to go

we didn't have plates and

did you think about that, so

because she got all

1749.75.text:
role that the youth 
that we serve,

1752.58.text:
the at-risk youth, 
that most of them are,

1755.96.text:
it's a way for them to fill

1762.05.text:
they might not be
getting at home.

A lot of our programs run
right after school

1766.18.text:
and they might run up until
9:00 at night

1768.43.text:
and if you think about it
that means that their parents

1771.77.text:

"before care,"

1774.19.text:
before they go to school, get

1776.61.text:
They're in school all day, we
have them right after school

1779.61.text:
and they're with us up until
up to 9/9:30 at night.

1783.20.text:
So what kind of role
are those parents taking

1787.24.text:
There's a big gap there and
obviously that's where

1790.21.text: we want to try and fill it.

1791.79.text:
So the activity that we do with
them is called

1797.80.text:
Best Part/Worst Part and it
happens in our opening circle

1801.80.text:
where we give the kids
any announcements

1805.22.text:
We start at the beginning of the
week with Best Part/Worst part:

1812.64.text:
What was the best part
of your day and why

1815.81.text:
and what was the worst part 
and why?

1817.23.text:
It gives us a chance to show
that as leaders and role models

1822.65.text:
we care about these kids, we are
invested in their interests,

1826.83.text:
what they like, what they find
is good and makes them happy

1834.83.text:
and on the other scale what
they find challenging,

1838.46.text:
what means that they've had a
bad day, and that opens up a lot

1843.84.text:
of opportunities for us 
to then engage them further,

1848.06.text:
and try to plan activities
that mean that we could

1854.02.text:
or try to address some of
those things that they've said.

1856.86.text:
You know: "Oh I've had an awful
day because of this or that."

1859.27.text:
So it really gets them talking
about them and their interests

1865.86.text:
and how their day was 
and we do other things,

1869.87.text:
we ask them other questions,
(all open-ended obviously)

1873.04.text:
and try to get them thinking
about things

1879.88.text:
other than what stuff they're
talking about with their friends

1887.51.text:
and whatnot and challenge them
to think a little bit further

1894.27.text:
So, our goal there is to
strengthen their exposure to

1901.90.text:
and their bonds with
a caring adult, right?

Someone who's that older
figure that they might not have

a lot of contact with

1909.12.text:
outside of their teacher, which

a bit outside the box,

and something that's creative,

their own instrument

2045.71.text:

2053.89.text:

2064.31.text:
early on that will hopefully

2068.61.text:
of learning new physical
activities, and being involved

2072.28.text:
and getting moving
and active and whatnot.

So acrokids I guess is a new

as well right now, kind of like

We've scaled it down into

different things and

well because if you're getting

2768.18.text:
the teachers on board, and
they're believing

2769.77.text:
in your program as well, they
going to be referring students

2772.77.text:
to your program and then if
your principal's switching

2774.98.text:
or your vice principal is
switching, then you still have

2778.19.text:
So every time we have
a parent event,

2780.53.text:
all I would say the majority
of the school staff are there

2783.20.text:
and they're participating
in the event as well.

2785.99.text:
So we find that really
helps us out a lot.

2788.41.text:
[Faye Jose] I have one more
quick point to add too,

2790.41.text:
that currently the Ministry of
Education has repealed

2794.63.text:
the Day Nurseries Act so there
is work happening

2797.21.text:
with both the legislative
framework and the regulatory

2800.80.text:
framework of the Day Nurseries
Act and municipalities responded

2805.80.text:
to that repeal around what
should childcare look like

2810.22.text:
and in that was also responses
around what does care for

2817.23.text: six to twelve years look like?

2819.03.text:
One of the pieces that is coming
out of that and our strategy

2824.24.text:
actually and the research
actually gave us some of

2827.83.text:
the information to be able to
respond so the City of Toronto

2831.83.text:
and the Middle Childhood
Coalition did a response

2836.67.text:
that identified that we need
consistent work

2840.46.text:
with school boards and the
Ministry of Education

2842.84.text:
and they need to really address
the six- to twelve-year olds.

2846.84.text:
And the Ministry of Education
has identified that

2848.85.text:
that is the next age group
that they will address.

2851.47.text:
They have looked at the
four and five year olds.

2853.68.text:
The next age group will be the
six to twelve.

2855.48.text:
So it will be interesting for
all of us as providers

2859.48.text:
and recreationists to be able
to see what that looks like

2866.70.text:
and what happens with that
because that's going to mandate

2868.87.text:
the schoo ls to work with us
related to care

2871.87.text: for six to twelve year olds.
